subNodes.conversationText: root
"No doubt you have questions."
"When did this happen?"
"The attack was only hours ago. I came straight here from the site of the ambush."
Continue
"I heard about it just before you did."
"At least the trail will be warm."
"No doubt you have questions."
"Why weren't you with the rest of your men when they were killed, Kano?"
"On our journey to South Worlde we came across a strange lizard like woman. The Captain thought she was a threat and ordered me to take her back to the tower for questioning."
Continue

"I have heard of such creatures. They are called Iskin. They live in the swamps west of Gungerad. They can be frightening in appearance but not generally violent, and it is unusual to hear of one so far from the swamps."
"Where is the Iskin now?"
"It is in the cells at the Tower. It said nothing to me, but it was clearly very agitated. Perhaps you should interrogate it."
"Perhaps."
"No doubt you have questions."
"Did the Baron say anything whilst he was in your custody, Borian?"
"Nothing coherant, but I did not spend much time with him and asked no questions. I had no wish to hear some secret or another that might make my position uncomfortable."
"How long was he prisoner here for?"
"He was in my basement for four days. I gave him bread and water and did not mistreat him. He saw no one else during that time."
Continue
"No doubt you have questions."
"Who knew that the Baron was being kept here?"

"We kept the information as closely guarded as we could. The druid Rubian was the one who initially found the Baron roaming the woods and brought him in. Rubian is no doubt out in the woods once more if you want to speak to her."
Continue

"I recognised the Baron immediately of course, and had him locked in my basement. I sent a messenger to the Tower, a boy called Norris. The message was still sealed on delivery though, was it not, Kano?"
Continue
"It was. The seal was broken by the Captain. He sent the boy back without knowledge of the letter's contents."
Continue
"On my side, all of the Guard knew. But they are now all dead, except for Gilhean who was left behind to guard the tower. I cannot believe he had anything to do with this, though."
"Perhaps. Perhaps not. I should speak to him."
"Aside from that, only the Captain of the ship I sent to inform the Chancellor knew. But he was travelling in the wrong direction to be involved."
Continue
"No doubt you have questions."
"Any suggestions about where to start looking?"

"There are many bandits roaming the woods these days, hungry for gold and power. It could be one of their groups. And one can never truly rule out the Skaal. Their truce with Blackwinter is somewhat... flexible. They are often found to have their claws deep in such matters."
Continue
"Skaal haven't been seen in these parts for months, Borian. This must be have been organised locally. There is a village called Lakeside, due east of here, that would be worth investigating."
Continue
"The Lakesiders may be strange, but I very much doubt they would have anything to do with this, Kano."
"Strange? What do you mean?"
"They have a... small town mentality. They are somewhat abrasive with outsiders and have caused us a few local difficulties over the years. But murder and high treason? I don't think so."
Continue
"Well, I don't trust them, Borian."
Continue
"The only other lead I can offer is to investigate the ambush of the King's Guard on the South Road. There may still be clues."
"Very well."
"No doubt you have questions."
"I think I've heard enough."
"Whatever you do next, I would like to come with you. Both our necks are on the line with this."
"You would be most welcome, Kano."
"Thank you. I will not fail you."
Continue
"Very touching. Keep me informed of what you find during your investigations."
"That depends entirely on what I find out."
"Of course."
"You've already failed once. I have no need of you."
"A very sensible choice, I feel."
Continue

"I have no trust in you finding the Baron on your own. I will leave town tonight and neither of you will see me again."

Kano spins on his heel and leaves the room.
Continue
"Well, I think we've found our scapegoat. Keep me informed of what you find during your investigations."
"That depends entirely on what I find out."
"Of course."
